verbose_text: All three treatments significantly reduced HbA 1c compared with baseline (-0.3% [colesevelam], -0.6% [rosiglitazone], and -0.4% [sitagliptin]; P < 0.05 for all); however, colesevelam significantly reduced LDL cholesterol levels as well (-11.6%; P = 0.0012), suggesting colesevelam may be an ideal second-line treatment option providing significant glucose- and lipid lowering benefits in patients with type 2 diabetes.
